Cancer Code¶

Below is a skeleton of the code contained in the code.cancer.py file. Below should be summaries of the contents, as well as links to the source itself.

CancerSim Class¶

The main cancer simulation class

class code.cancer.CancerSim(boxsize=(20, 20), basal_height=10.0, seed=None, xi=2.0, a=0.1)[source]¶

The main Cancer Simulation Class.

Creates an array of Cells, allows for the designation of cancer cells And the evolution of the cells thereafter.

add_bond(one, two)[source]¶

Add a bond between cells one and two

add_cancer_cell(x, r, eps=None)[source]¶

randomly make a cell a cancer cell

add_cell(cell)[source]¶

Add the cell: cell

delaunay()[source]¶

Delaunay routine, sets the initial links

duplicate_cancer_cell(cancer=None, disp_frac=0.15)[source]¶

Duplicate the cancer cell: cancer

energy[source]¶

get the energy of the current configuration

fire(fmax=0.1, Nmin=5.0, finc=1.1, fdec=0.5, alphastart=0.1, fa=0.99, deltatmax=10.0, maxsteps=100000)[source]¶

Do a fire relaxation

force_func(cell1, cell2)[source]¶

the native force function between two positions

force_func2(cell1, cell2)¶

the native force function between two positions, second attempt

force_func_hertz(cell1, cell2)¶

the Hertz force between two cells

forces[source]¶

get the forces between cells, as array, both from links and from the native force_func

get_neighbors(cell)[source]¶

Get the linked neighbor cells of cell

get_pos_arr(force=False)[source]¶

Get an array of all of the cell positions

jiggle(sigma=0.1, ghosts=True)[source]¶

Jiggle the atom positions

plot_cells(clf=True, fignum=1, ghosts=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the current configuration

plot_links(clf=False, cutoff=None, fignum=1, ghosts=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the links between cells

plot_sized_cells(clf=True, fignum=1, ghosts=False, *args, **kwargs)¶

Plot the current configuration using circles

remove_bond(one, two)[source]¶

Remove a bond between cells one and two

remove_cell(cell)[source]¶

Remove the cell: cell, and all bonds for that cell

time_step()[source]¶

Run a time step, duplicate a cancer cell, do a FIRE relaxation, and plot
